snippet: The French will miss Nicolas Sarkozy more than they realize.
abstract: Op-Ed article by author Rosecrans Baldwin reflects on French Pres Nicolas Sarkozy's legacy in light of his failed re-election bid; asserts that Sarkozy transformed how the French think of the presidency and how Americans view the French. (M)
lead_paragraph: FRANCE is glad to be rid of Nicolas Sarkozy, who lost the country's presidency in a runoff election this weekend to the Socialist candidate, François Hollande. He was ineffective in office, and prone to gaffes in public. But the French will miss him more than they realize. Beneath the boorishness, the cringe-worthy comments, he transformed how France thinks of the presidency, just as he altered what America thinks of the French.
